intro: Vogtia, commonly known as the dwarf sedge, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Cyperaceae. It consists of several species that are typically small, herbaceous plants with narrow, grass-like leaves. Vogtia species are often found in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. They produce small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikes, which are characteristic of the sedge family. These plants play an important role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various small organisms.
